jparsec.util

Class JPARSECException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • jparsec.util.JPARSECException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class JPARSECException
extends java.lang.Exception
implements java.io.Serializable
    An exception is thrown if the caller attempts to pass an invalid value, or the results of a calculation generate an invalid operation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • DISABLE_WARNINGS

        public static boolean DISABLE_WARNINGS
        Set to true to disable the processing of warning messages. Default value is false.

      • addWarning

        public static void addWarning(java.lang.String warning)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Adds a warning. Care should be taken in order to avoid sending too much warnings, that could freeze the execution.
        Parameters:
        warning - Warning to add.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if treatWarningsAsErrors is set to true.

      • treatWarningsAsErrors

        public static void treatWarningsAsErrors(boolean warningsAsErrors)
        Sets whether to treat warning as errors or not.
        Parameters:
        warningsAsErrors - True for treating warnings as errors.

      • getCode

        public static int getCode(java.lang.String error_or_warning)
        Gives an unique code for certain error or warning depending on the string description message. It can be used to avoid confusions when constructing warnings and exceptions by giving only a message description, since such code can be cached with this method before launching certain exception with a given message. Also it allows to avoid duplication of warnings.
        Parameters:
        error_or_warning - Description message.
        Returns:
        Code for the error/warning.

      • getCurrentMethodName

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentMethodName()
        Returns the name of the method which is being executed.
        Returns:
        Method name.

      • getCurrentTrace

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentTrace()

        Returns:
        The trace.

      • getLastMethodName

        public static java.lang.String getLastMethodName()

        Returns:
        Method name.
